summary: This document is an email chain between attorney Jeffrey S. Pop and a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York, scheduling and outlining the scope of a meeting with Pop's client, a victim/witness in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistical arrangements, topics to be covered (including the client's contact with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and her role in contacting other girls), and ground rules to avoid causing emotional trauma.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pop
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is a victim/witness in the SDNY Epstein investigation. He is scheduling a meeting with prosecutors and setting boundaries for the interview to protect his client from emotional trauma.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to by the nickname 'girl finder' in the context of the client's information regarding Epstein's comments about her. Implicated in the facilitation of abuse.

connections.description: Pop is the legal representative for an unnamed female client who is a victim/witness cooperating with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The client had contact with Jeffrey Epstein and his associates and was a victim of abuse, as indicated by the need to avoid details that cause 'emotional trauma'.
The client has information about Epstein's comments regarding Maxwell and her role ('girl finder'), suggesting the client's knowledge of Maxwell's activities within Epstein's circle.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with Victim/Witness
events.description: A meeting scheduled at Jeffrey Pop's office in Beverly Hills between Pop, his client, Assistant U.S. Attorneys, and an FBI agent to discuss the client's knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Beverly Hills, California 90212-3429 (Jeffrey S. Pop's office)
keyFacts: A victim/witness, represented by attorney Jeffrey Pop, agreed to meet with SDNY prosecutors and an FBI agent on February 28, 2020, to discuss her knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

The planned discussion topics included the 'logistical' narrative of how the client came into contact with Epstein, her general interactions with him and his associates, Epstein's comments about Maxwell as a 'girl finder', and the client's role in having contact with other girls at Epstein's direction.

The attorney explicitly set boundaries, stating that details of the abuse itself and any information about 'monetary contribution / support/ assistance' involving his client were off-limits to avoid causing emotional trauma.
The client was reportedly hesitant to identify friends of Epstein's that she was directed to visit, indicating knowledge of other individuals in Epstein's network.
The email chain demonstrates the ongoing investigative efforts by the SDNY in early 2020, focusing on victim testimony and the operational dynamics of Epstein's circle.
